it.polimi.constraintcomputation.subpropertyidentifier.labeling

Class BackwardLabeler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.constraintcomputation.subpropertyidentifier.labeling.BackwardLabeler

  • public class BackwardLabeler
extends Object
    it is used to label with the specified label all the outgoing transitions of a sub-property
    It modifies the sub-property contained in the SubPropertyIdentifier passed as parameter
    Author:
    Claudio Menghi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BackwardLabeler(Set<State> states, Label label, SubPropertyIdentifier subProperty)
      creates a new Backward labeler function.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void perform()
      modifies the outgoing transitions of the sub-property with the following policy:
      if the outgoing transition allows to reach a SSC that contains an accepting state that can be entered infinitely often, the outgoing transition is marked with the label specified as parameter

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackwardLabeler

        public BackwardLabeler(Set<State> states,
               Label label,
               SubPropertyIdentifier subProperty)
        creates a new Backward labeler function. This function is used to mark with the specified label all the outgoing transitions of the sub-property
        Parameters:
        states - is the set of the states of the intersection automaton to be considered
        label - is the label to be associated with the outgoing transitions
        subProperty - is the sub-property to be considered by the BackwardLabeler
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the parameters is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the set of the states to be considered is not included in the set of the states of the automaton

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        public void perform()
        modifies the outgoing transitions of the sub-property with the following policy:
        if the outgoing transition allows to reach a SSC that contains an accepting state that can be entered infinitely often, the outgoing transition is marked with the label specified as parameter
